greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1, and for n >= 2, a(n) = prime(bigomega(n)), where prime(n) = A000040(n) and bigomega(n) = A001222(n).
comment: a(n) divides A122111(n), A242424(n), A243072(n), A243073(n) because a(n) divides all the terms in column n of A243070.
a(2n-1) divides A243505(n) and a(2n-1)^2 divides A122111(2n-1).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: def a001222(n): return 0 if n==1 else a001222(n/primefactors(n)[0]) + 1
def a(n): return 1 if n==1 else prime(a001222(n)) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 15 2017
results.author: _Cino Hilliard_, May 03 2005
